title.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, Feb. 1, 1923. Fish Dealers First to Contribute to Chicago Building of Los Angeles Sanatorium

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

div.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, Feb. 1, 1923. FISH DEALERS FIRST TO CONTRIBUTE TO CHICAGO BUILDING OF LOS ANGELES SANATORIUM

body.p: At a banquet of the Fish Dealers Association, last Sunday evening, the sum of $126.25 was raised, following an appeal made by Madame Fannie Rinehart, for the Chicago-Los Angeles Sanatorium for Consumptives.

There are a great many Chicago Jews in the Los Angeles Sanatorium. A movement is now on foot to establish a Chicago division for the Chicago victims of the white plague. The Fish Dealers were the first to respond by contributing their share to this enterprise.
